imdb.plot outline: In Your Neighborhood Episode 1 Director Bill Perrine brings us It's Gonna Blow, a documentary about San Diego's underground music history during the decade from 1986 to 1996. Lou Niles narrates as Perrine shows archival performance footage, pictures, and interviews, painting a stunningly vivid picture of a musically rich decade in San Diego and Southern California history. It's Gonna Blow probes the minds of bands like Rocket from the Crypt, Fugazi, Sub Society, Drive Like Jehu, Blink-182, and more to find insight into San Diego's early '90s underground music scene.
imdb.title: In Your Neighborhood w/ Lou Niles
akas: In Your Neighborhood w/ Lou Niles (United States)
plot: Lou travels to Escondido to talk with D Dove and her collaborators about recording, inspiration and her forthcoming album.::Lou Niles

In Your Neighborhood Episode 1 Director Bill Perrine brings us It's Gonna Blow, a documentary about San Diego's underground music history during the decade from 1986 to 1996. Lou Niles narrates as Perrine shows archival performance footage, pictures, and interviews, painting a stunningly vivid picture of a musically rich decade in San Diego and Southern California history. It's Gonna Blow probes the minds of bands like Rocket from the Crypt, Fugazi, Sub Society, Drive Like Jehu, Blink-182, and more to find insight into San Diego's early '90s underground music scene.::Lou Niles

D.Dove is a hip-hop artist based out of San Diego, CA known for her acclaimed record produced by Factor entitled "Screwg Mc Dovey", she has toured nationwide and has developed an organic following earning her high profile touring slots and a reputation for staying true to her art form. Her next official release is said to be an album entitled "Chish" co-produced by Dj Tramlife featuring her classic delivery over a fresh landscape that many are excited to hear. Founded on the ethos that love can conquer all, Love Machine Films thrives when the lens is on the soul of the people. We are on the front lines in the fight to save humanity. Breast cancer, children with diabetes, the malaria epidemic of south-east Asia, or the suicides of teenagers, we are showing these plights successfully through the poetic medium of film, tv, music and photo. Love Machine Films has the client roster and years to back our major commercial acclaim both here in the U.S and internationally. Again our ethos is simple: Love can conquer all.::Lou Niles
